snippet.textDisplay: Both Shenmue games have fantastic soundtracks but if you mean the games themselves then yes it is. The first game is very slow paced and takes a while to get to the good parts and you can't skip time. You can in Shenmue 2 and the areas to explore are huge and more detailed and the pacing is better. But unless you're a pretty patient player then Shenmue probably isn't a good game series for you. Otherwise you'll probably like it quite a bit; 2 is my favourite game. Hope that helps :)
snippet.textOriginal: Both Shenmue games have fantastic soundtracks but if you mean the games themselves then yes it is. The first game is very slow paced and takes a while to get to the good parts and you can't skip time. You can in Shenmue 2 and the areas to explore are huge and more detailed and the pacing is better. But unless you're a pretty patient player then Shenmue probably isn't a good game series for you. Otherwise you'll probably like it quite a bit; 2 is my favourite game. Hope that helps :)

snippet.textDisplay:
i played sleeping dogs tough,besides the fact that the game is in Hong Kong and the chasing scenes,the game is not really that similiar to shenmue it has a similiar feel i can't deny that,but it also has a huge gta one,while yakuza is more like an rpg,where you explore a town and have a lot of mini-games(including real arcade games has of yakuza 5 like virtua fighter) and it also has qte in fights has of 3 i think.
But non of both of these has a fighthing system has deep has shenmue.

snippet.textDisplay:
As someone that played Shenmue 1 and 2 i have to say Sleeping Dogs reminds me a lot more to Shenmue than Yakuza does.

Yakuza have similarities but it doesn't feel the same.
Sleeping dogs is a great game anyway, nothing lost trying it.

snippet.textDisplay: Haven't gone to Japan yet (will be in a few years, super excited) but have lived in Kowloon City, Hong Kong a short time as a very young child about 20 years ago. The roasted chestnuts in the morning, the double-decker buses, the Bruce Lee toys, the ferry rides, Ocean Park, Lion Rock, and the warm people. I miss it dearly; one of the most beautiful places in the world. And this track ain't helping one bit, Supra. Heh, I urge you, no IMPLORE you to visit Hong Kong at least once in your life.
snippet.textOriginal: Haven't gone to Japan yet (will be in a few years, super excited) but have lived in Kowloon City, Hong Kong a short time as a very young child about 20 years ago. The roasted chestnuts in the morning, the double-decker buses, the Bruce Lee toys, the ferry rides, Ocean Park, Lion Rock, and the warm people. I miss it dearly; one of the most beautiful places in the world. And this track ain't helping one bit, Supra. Heh, I urge you, no IMPLORE you to visit Hong Kong at least once in your life.

snippet.textDisplay: Shenmue 1+2 is probably my #1. It's nice to see it up there. I would pay so much money to get them on PSN/XBL even direct ports. Even if Shenmue 3 is too expensive for a Kickstarter, Sega should try one for PSN/XBL release. They emulate poorly and dreamcasts and XBOXs die out, soon it won't be possible to play them in all their glory.

snippet.textDisplay: It was more than just playing a video game for me, Shenmue 1&2 provided me with an unforgettable﻿ experience. It felt like I was traveling to Japan and Hong Kong and it's one of the big reasons I really want to go there someday. If I could ask for any single sequel to be created, it'd be Shenmue III.
snippet.textOriginal: It was more than just playing a video game for me, Shenmue 1&2 provided me with an unforgettable﻿ experience. It felt like I was traveling to Japan and Hong Kong and it's one of the big reasons I really want to go there someday. If I could ask for any single sequel to be created, it'd be Shenmue III.

snippet.textDisplay: This theme is a masterpiece, just like the series. Honestly, I can't separate Shenmue 1 and 2, they're both tied. I probably have more nostalgia for the 1st (played it around Christmas while it was snowing out my window) but Shenmue II is longer and more polished. Shenmue 1&2 didn't age too well because of the tank controls and the graphics not being mind blowing anymore (they definitely were back then). However the story, the audiovisual presentation and the atmosphere is﻿ still among the best.
snippet.textOriginal: This theme is a masterpiece, just like the series. Honestly, I can't separate Shenmue 1 and 2, they're both tied. I probably have more nostalgia for the 1st (played it around Christmas while it was snowing out my window) but Shenmue II is longer and more polished. Shenmue 1&2 didn't age too well because of the tank controls and the graphics not being mind blowing anymore (they definitely were back then). However the story, the audiovisual presentation and the atmosphere is﻿ still among the best.
